page.title: 10Village Life. Mr. Lidgett.
page.content: We went to visit Mr. and Mrs. Lidgett for our Domesday Project. They live at Green Field House in Heapham. Their home includes 7 acres of land. One part is used for digging and planting and the rest are fields. Mr. Lidgett was born in Sringthorpe and went to the village school until he was 13 years old. When he was a young boy his father owned a pig. When he killed the pig he blew the pig's bladder up and gave it to Mr. Lidgett to use as a football. Before Mr. Lidgett went to school in the morning he had to drive some cows down a long lane. One day something came and frightened the cows and Mr. Lidgett was late for school and had the cane on his hand for being late. Mr. and Mrs. Lidgett have 3 sons and 4 grandchildren but they have moved out of the area. { See next page.
